Package com.clorem.db

Class Clorem

java.lang.Object
com.clorem.db.Clorem
public class Clorem extends Object
Clorem is an android open-source no-SQL database. This is similar to firebase's real-time database with only of local database support.
Since:
12-10-2021
Author:
Rahil khan

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static Clorem getInstance(android.content.Context context, String databaseName)
      This will initialize your database. Initialization may take time if there is too much data stored in database. If you feel that it is making UI unresponsive, then put this in another thread. Remember : This method is singleton and runs synchronously. Calling this second time will return the same database instance doesn't matter which database name you have passed.
      Parameters:
      context - The context of the activity
      databaseName - The name of the database you want to open or create.
      Returns:
      instance of the class

    • getDatabase

      public Node getDatabase()
      Gets the main database class through which you can perform any CRUD operations on the database. This database is like a JSON tree which contain nodes and mappings.
      Returns:
      The root node of the database.

    • enableEncoding

      public Clorem enableEncoding(boolean enabled)
      Sets if the data should be encrypted before commenting to the database. Default value is false
      Parameters:
      enabled - true to enable encryption, ignore otherwise.

    • getDatabaseAsJson

      public String getDatabaseAsJson()
      Preview your database structure in the form of JSON.
      Returns:
      A human readable JSON string.

    • delete

      public void delete()
      Deletes this database. If the database is currently open or the app is reading or writing to database, deletion may fail.
